attributes.action: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to make it a criminal offence to prescribe psychotropic drugs to patients or people in custody where the sole intention is to subdue/pacify a patient for expediency. Ensure that permission is sought from the patient's advocate such as next of kin for all prescriptions and the advocate is provided with a written statement justifying the prescription and full details of any side-effects.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
People with mental illnesses such as dementia should be getting nutritional and cognitive therapy instead of toxic psychotropic drugs for expediency and institutional convenience.

An BBC panorama investigation 'Please Look After Dad' broadcast on the 3rd December has alleged routine abuse of antipsychotic drugs on Alzheimer patient's.

Neil Hunt, chief executive of the Alzheimer's society, said: "Thousands of people with dementia are routinely prescribed dangerous antipsychotic drugs, increasing their chance of death and causing distressing side effects such as excessive sedation, motor problems and dizziness. 

"These drugs should only be used as a last resort when all other options have been exhausted. 

"The all-party parliamentary group inquiry into the use of antipsychotic drugs in care homes is an important step in understanding the scale of this serious problem." 

Harriet Millward, deputy chief executive of the Alzheimer's Research Trust, said: "We have serious concerns about the long-term use of antipsychotics in people with dementia.
